data:
The Praxis-HAK is an Austrian vocational school with higher education entrance qualification. We provide our students’ with a professional and up-to-date education, which facilitates a good and quick entrance into the working world.
In recent years, in and around Völkermarkt, there has been a growing demand for a workforce with international experience, professional qualifications, transparent mobility and especially language competence. The new program Erasmus+ enables us to prepare the students for these business demands.
As the applicant (home institution) we managed to acquire different businesses in Europe (host institutions) to work with us. In summer 2017 three students will do their internships abroad (one in England, one in Ireland and one in Northern Ireland). We are still searching for additional partners in the English-speaking countries. In the future (next school year 2017/18), we would like to offer all students the possibility to do an internship in the European Union.
The three students who are going to do the internship abroad are keen language users. They will work for our excellent partner companies which have already signed long-term partnership agreements or plan to do it with our school. In the 2017/18 school year, we would like to acquire additional partner companies.
Through participating in the Erasmus+ support program, the students will not only expand and perfect their professional skills but also their language abilities. In addition, they will get to know a foreign culture and its people and build social networks for the future. Such experiences are of vital importance to young people when it comes to shaping their personalities. Also, it can be a stepping-stone for building their future.
The partner companies are willing to share their daily work with the students and will assign them a mentor who will accompany and support them throughout the entire internship. Moreover, the mentor will hold several talks with the students, record their professional skills, and language competencies.  In the end, they will put them into writing in the form of a learning agreement.
In addition, the partner companies pledged to give the students a respective certificate (personal assessment) and the Europass-Mobility of the internship.
During the internship the students will not only record their tasks but also their professional and private experiences in order to publish them on the school website and the school Facebook site at the end of the project. We also plan to have the students organize an event in Völkermarkt to thank the host institutions in person and on behalf of the school again with hopes to foster relationships between the school and the companies.

Title: Second Step in Europe 
Theme: Reception issues for Customers’ Care, Management/Administration and Logistic Transport students.

Direct and indirect actors:
- 6 training institutions or placement companies,
- more than 40 companies in 5 countries
- 46 young people preparing vocational high school diplomas in Customers’ Care, Management/Administration and Logistic Transport (level IV, from 17 to 20 years old), 
- The 9 EFP staffs who will go on training period abroad,
- Teachers / Students’ guides,
- The teams at the initiative of the project in the 6 partner organisations,
- The companies which will welcome the participants,
- All the pupils of the other classes and sections, 
- The students’ families,
- The administrative and educational teams, 
- The academic and diocesan authorities
- Our local partners

Where:
- France (sending organisation)
- England, Germany, Spain, Norway and Sweden (recieving organisations).

When:
- Total duration of the project: 2 years 
- A placement of 29 days in March / April, 2018 and 2019

Why:
Our project respects the objectives of the EU, it meets the needs of students’ curriculum but it also meets the expectations of the pupils, eager to discover other cultural and professionnal horizons. We have to adapt the curriculum of the young participants to the new requirements of mobility and adaptability of working life, these future professionals have to become aware of the flows of staffs in a Europe without borders.

Objectives:
- Enrich and develop the professional skills of the young people in first degree training,
- Acquire a professional autonomy and a linguistic ease to fit into an international working team,
- Offer to the participants an experience leading to a qualification,
- Facilitate access to employment thanks to a European mobility,
- Acquire skills in ITC,
- Give an international experience to the students’ CV, a genuine added value for their future recuitement
- Fight against early school leaving and social inequalities,
- Enrich and diversify the educational practices of the EFP staffs 
- Export and import know-hows 
- Give an European dimension to our high school
- Get schools and companies to work together
- Develop a coherent training network 
- Promote understanding and cooperation between European young people

Contents:
- A placement abroad in a company for 27 days, 
- Meetings and workshops with European young people of the same generation, 
- Cultural and professional visits,
- 4 main phases: selection and preparation of the participants (professional, linguistic and cultural), mobility and placement in companies, project assessment and dissemination.

Impacts:
- Acquisition of new skills, 
- Obtaining tools to help the students’ to get a job on the labor market. 
- Improvement the access to employment,
- Fight against early school leaving,
- Renewal and sustainability of the project in 2019,
- Improvement of the teachers’ professional, practical and theoretical skills.

The project involves six students of class 1 Bachelor Professional automotive maintenance.

Students will stay their entire probationary period ( 4 weeks) in May 2018 on site in Omagh in Northern Ireland .

They will be supported and installed on site by Mrs Poncet ( English teacher ) and Mr Perrier ( teacher automobile maintenance) LP Argensol .

Teachers will return on site during the fourth week of training to assess students at their place of employment .

Students will be housed and fed in Bed and Breakfast . Our local partners, members of the educational and administrative team at South West College will be referring on site and be our tutors for underage students as they were prior to our mobility. ( 2011, 2012 , 2013 et 2014)

This is Pat O'Hanlon Head of the workshops, Sharon Mc Sorley account officer , Barry O'Neill in charge of the work placements.

The objectives are to open our students to Europe and so, show them that we are part of a common European space. It is for them to realize that Europe is a place of life and work in which it is easy to move and work . This experience will surely give them thereafter taste,desire and want to  travel or work in a country of Europe.
Our partners (SWC,Garages involved for many years as well as the whole mecanic teachers team) help us to find the garages ,check the activities and skills involved in the work placement.
 They are also a permanent contact for our students once in autonomy.
They create social links with the tutors,teachers and students and organize a program of cultural,leisure activities
